required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluating the Foot Touch Framework Model
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluating the Foot Touch Framework Model in Running

brief_summary.textblock: A Foot Touch framework model has been developed to express the ground reaction force waveforms observed for walking and running. The purpose of this research is to collect ground reaction force data during walking and running that can be used to evaluate and verify the Foot Touch framework.

primary_outcome.description: Ground reaction forces for distinct anatomical regions of the foot (Calcaneal, Tarsal, Metatarsal, Phalangeal) measured by the MatScan system

secondary_outcome.description: Ground reaction force measured by the force plate during walking, running, and hopping tasks
Ankle joint angle measured by motion analysis system during walking, running, and hopping tasks
Knee joint angle measured by motion analysis system during walking, running, and hopping tasks
Hip joint angle measured by motion analysis system during walking, running, and hopping tasks

arm_group.description: All participants will be required to run unshod for a combination of four prescribed speeds (walking and up to 9 mph) and three different foot strike patterns (rearfoot, midfoot, and forefoot) on level ground.

intervention.description: Four speeds ranging from a set walking speed up to 9 mph
Foot strike sequences (rearfoot strike, midfoot strike, forefoot strike)

study_pop.textblock: Healthy, able-bodied participants will be recruited from the general public.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy adult men and women
- Capable of independently walking and running at various speeds for a minimum of 30 minutes
- No history of significant injuries in the past six months
- Ability to walk and run without shoes/footwear
- Ability to perform one- and two-footed hops up and down from 5 cm and 10 cm heights
- Ability to provide informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Confounding chronic injury or musculoskeletal problem
- Pregnancy
- Symptomatic cardiovascular disease or chronic obstructive pulmonary disease
- Not able to read and understand English
